name: James Hoffmann French Press recipe
short_description: French Press recipe by James Hoffmann, winner of World barista Championship, YouTuber, coffee consultant, and author. [Watch the tutorial](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=st571DYYTR8).

steps.description: Grind the coffee and put it into French Press. Place on scale and zero it out.
Add <final_water_amount>g. of water
Let the coffee sit.
Use a tablespoon to stir the crust on top of the brew. Remove the foam and floating particles.
Let the coffee rest for additional 5 minutes.
Put the plunger in, but don't press it all the way down, leave it on top of the brew. Pour gently.

name: Gwilym Davies French Press recipe
short_description: French press recipe by Gwilym Davies, World barista champion and SCA authorized trainer. Here's the [tutorial](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AkrqY8LkWM4).

steps.description: Grind the coffee and put it into French Press. Place on scale and zero it out.
Quickly add <final_water_amount>g of water.
Wait 5 minutes.
Use a tablespoon to mix coffee with water.
Insert the plunger, but don't press it down yet.
Wait 3 minutes.
Press the plunger down slowly.
Wait 2 minutes.
Pour the coffee into the carafe and wait for another 2 minutes before serving.

name: Scott Rao French Press recipe
short_description: French press recipe by Scott Rao, a coffee expert and author specializing in cafe operation, barista training, and coffee roasting and brewing.

steps.description: Grind the coffee and put it into French Press. Place on scale and zero it out.
Pour <final_water_amount>g of water at once, quickly, ensuring all the grounds are wet.
Place plunger 1 cm below the surface of coffee.
Wait 4 minutes.
Plunge the filter gently
Wait for coffee particles to settle and serve.

name: French Press for Supertasters by The Coffee Chronicler
short_description: French press recipe by Asser Christensen aka The Coffee Chronicler. This recipe aims for a clean and tasty brew. Note: this recipe requires you to use paper filters. Asser recommends to use basket-shape filters, the filter should fully cover the plunger and extend 2-3 cm on the sides or a bit more. [Check out detailed tutorial](https://coffeechronicler.com/how-to-make-french-press-recipe/).

steps.description: Fold your paper filter, place it in the brewer and rinse with hot water. Remove the filter and place it into the cup. Discard the water. Grind the coffee and put it into French Press. Place on scale and zero it out.
Add <final_water_amount>g of water, pouring aggressively.
Stir 8 times.
Gently squeeze the paper filter to get rid of excess water, and wrap it around the plunger.
Stir the surface of the brew gently to break any crust.
Wait.
Carefully insert the plunger with the paper filter attached. Plunge slowly.
Decant the brewed coffee into a carafe to bring it to an ideal drinking temperature.
